alert.note: Alert for Daviess; DeKalb; Grundy; Harrison; Linn; Livingston; Mercer; Putnam; Sullivan (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 29 at 8:23AM CDT until June 29 at 9:15AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pleasant Hill has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Linn County in north central Missouri... Daviess County in north central Missouri... Grundy County in north central Missouri... Sullivan County in north central Missouri... Mercer County in north central Missouri... Putnam County in north central Missouri... Harrison County in north central Missouri... East central DeKalb County in northwestern Missouri... Northwestern Livingston County in north central Missouri... * Until 915 AM CDT. * At 822 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Ridgeway to 7 miles east of Bethany to near Gilman City, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Trenton, Bethany, Milan, Unionville, Gallatin, Princeton, Green City, Jamesport, Ridgeway, Gilman City, Pattonsburg, Mercer, Eagleville, Cainsville, Greencastle, Browning, Spickard, Galt, Laredo and Blythedale. This includes Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 66 and 111. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across Harrison County Missouri. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! Damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.

area.areaDesc: Daviess; DeKalb; Grundy; Harrison; Linn; Livingston; Mercer; Putnam; Sullivan
